You are an assistant to answer About School
What is the school`s mission and vision?

Mission Educates and molds individuals into productive and valuable citizens in the country and to be globally competitive, equipped with technologically advanced knowledge and skills to meet the demands of the dynamic society. -	Vision Northern Mindanao Colleges, Inc. envisions globally competitive, academically excellent, socially responsible and morally upright individuals through technological, educational and holistic development

What scholarships are offered by the school?
The school offers scholarships including the CHED Scholarship, Institutional Scholarships, and Other Government Scholarships.

What documents are required when applying for scholarships?
Commonly required documents include transcripts, letters of recommendation, a personal statement, and a completed application forms
You are an assistant to answer the apply for scholarships as a transfer student
Can I apply for scholarships as a transfer student??
Yes, transfer students can often apply for scholarships, although eligibility may vary.
You are an assistant to answer the increase my chances of receiving a scholarship
How can I increase my chances of receiving a scholarship??
To increase your chances, maintain a strong academic record, participate in extracurricular activities, write compelling essays, and meet all application deadlines
You are an assistant to answer the role of the scholarship committee in the selection process
What is the role of the scholarship committee in the selection process?
The scholarship committee typically reviews applications, determines eligibility, and selects scholarship recipients based on established criteria.

Senior High School includes Academic Tracks and Tech-Vocational Livelihood Tracks; High School is from Grade 7 to Grade 10, Elementary from Grade 1 to Grade 6, and Preschool from Nursery 1, Nursery 2, and Kinder

What should female student follow when they are inside the school?
Keep your upper clothing out of the tuck. Except when worn for religious reasons, bottom skirts are prohibited during school hours.

You are an assistant to answer the Requirements for transferees
What are the admission requirements of the school for transferees?

These are the requirements, which include Transfer Credentials, a photocopy of the NSO/PSA Certificate of Live Birth, a certificate of good moral character from the previous school attended, a transcript of records, and two copies (2x2) of a photo.
You are an assistant to answer the Requirements for freshmen

These are the requirements, which include a photocopy of the NSO/PSA Certificate of Live Birth, a certificate of good moral character from the previous school attended, a transcript of records, and two copies (2x2) of a photo.
You are an assistant to answer the CIT vision
What is the CITs vision?
The College of Information Technology has its vision to produce quality graduates that are competent, intellectual, skillful and versatile coupled with ethical values and social responsibility.
You are an assistant to answer the CIT mission
What is the CITs mission?

The College of Information Technology develops and molds stakeholders through immense inculcation of the technological knowledge and skills coupled with high morale, professional ethical values and socially responsible that suits the challenging demands of the new generation.
You are an assistant to answer the school visiont
What is the schools vision?

Northern Mindanao Colleges, Inc. envisions globally competitive, academically excellent, socially responsible and morally upright individuals through technological, educational and holistic development.
You are an assistant to answer the School mission
What is the schools mission?

Educates and molds individuals into productive and valuable citizens in the country and to be globally competitive, equipped with technologically advanced knowledge and skills to meet the demands of the dynamic society.
You are an assistant to answer the History of the School
What is the history of the school?

Cabadbaranons founded the Northern Mindanao Institute (NORMI) on March 15, 1946, After World War II. With 250 students, the school was housed in a residential building owned by the late Antonio and Segunda Dagani. After three years, the Bureau of Private School requested a new school building and ground. The school's board of directors was organized, with Engr. Fidel C. Dagani Sr. as President and Director. In 1972, Ceferino L. Baltazar Sr. took over as Director, and Dr. Eladio Pro Anino was elevated to the Directorship..In 1972, a conflagration destroyed the school, but a three-story complex of forty-eight rooms was built through joint efforts of the Atega sisters, Mrs. Basilisa Atega Kittilstedvt and the late Mrs. Prosperidad Atega Rodriguez. The school was razed in 2001, and the old SEC registrations had not been renewed. After the death of Dr. Eladio Pro Anino, NORMI held elections for the new Board of Directors, with Engr. Manuel A. Rodriguez elected as chairman and President. In 2003, the SEC registration was approved under the name New Northern Mindanao Colleges. The BOD of New NORMI authorized Mr. George C. Cabrera to continue as President or Chief Executive Officer until the old NORMI was merged into New NORMI.

For excused absences, a parent or guardian must write a note outlining the cause for the absence.

Cell phones should be turned off or on silent during class hours, however students may use them during breaks.
